result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob J Shimko was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
DE will complete an AODA assessment and complete any follow up treatment recommended.

DE will comply with all conditions as listed by the DOC agent.

DE will pay court costs, provide DNA/pay surcharge.

Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob J Shimko

records.addlTxt:
1:08 PM Defendant Jacob J Shimko in court.  Attorney Stephen Donald Willett in court for Jacob J Shimko.  Attorney Emily Nelson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Heard along with 21CM145, 21TR458, 21TR459, 21TR460, 21TR461, 22CF48, 22CF125.  Time set for P/S.  Court has colloquy with DE on the right to appear in person before the court.  DE will waive his right to personal appearance.  

Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE advised of Constitutional Rights, Factual basis/ PC found, plea freely, knowingly, voluntarily, intelligently made, court accepts plea of NC, finds DE guilty. 

21CM145-Ct 1..NC

22CF48-Ct 1..NC and CT 3..NC

22CF125--Ct 2..NC

All other ct's and cases will be DRI.  DE will waive his right to PSI.  Sentencing argument entered by parties, ask the court to adopt the recommended sentence.  DE exercises his right to allocution, his happy with the progress he has made in his life and is liking it.

Court will order W/H sentence, 2 years probation.  DE will complete an AODA assessment and any follow up treatment recommended, DE will comply with all conditions recommended by DOC agent, pay CC/provide DNA/pay surcharge.  Atty has gone over appeal rights with his client. Adj 1:47pm.
Amended bonds and NOH all faxed to Fahrman Center this day

2:24 PM Defendant Jacob J Shimko appeared by video.  Attorney Stephen Donald Willett appeared by video for Jacob J Shimko.  Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Counsel Mekayla A appears via video.  

Heard along with 21TR458, 21TR459, 21TR460, 21TR461, 22CF48, 22CF125, 21CM145. 

Court calls the case.  Atty Willett calls Jacob Shimko, oath given.  DE is currently at the Fahrman Center in Eau Claire WI.  Mr Shimko would like his bond to be extended to allow his to continue treatment.  

State responds.  The State has received a letter from DOC.  

Atty Willett calls Mekayla Andrie, oath administered.  Direct by Atty Willett. MA outlines the progress DE has made thus far and the follow up treatment.

No cross by the State.  State has concerns that DE may fall back into his past patterns.  Atty Willett addresses the court as to DE's history.  

The court will has reservations, but will grant the extensions of signature bond. The court will grant all cash bonds to signature bonds, conditions will remain.  All cases will be set on the current date for court. Adj 4:22pm
Letter dated 9/21/22 from DOC agent Kyle Halbleib
Upon completion of 21 day inpatient treatment DE will return to RC Jail and a $1500.00 cash bond will go into effect.

2:37 PM Defendant Jacob J Shimko appeared by video.  Attorney Stephen Donald Willett appeared by video for Jacob J Shimko. DA Ellen Anderson appeared via video.   All matters heard together: 21CM145, 22CF48, 22CF125, 21TR458, 21TR459, 21TR460, and 21TR461.  Motion to amend bond  to allow DE to enter treatment center.   Attorney Willett makes argument to the Court.   Per Attorney Willett, DE can enter treatment center on 9/6/22.  DA Ellen Anderson's response.    Attorney Willett no obj. to assurances requested by the State.   Attorney Willett read a letter from DOC Agent.  DE made a statement.   Court ordered a $1500 signature bond at the time of treatment, when the DOC agent picked up DE to transport to inpatient treatment at Fahrman Center, to allow DE enter intensive inpatient treatment center.  All other conditions of bond remain during this time period.   Upon completion of inpatient treatment DE will be returned to the Rusk County Jail and the bond will be returned to $1500 cash with the conditions remaining.   State only agrees to the inpatient treatment but objects to additional time in the community on an aftercare treatment plan.    Attorney Willett argues importance of the aftercare.    Court ordered the signature bond only for time of extensive inpatient (21 day period) but will review the treatment plan and the possibility of continuing the signature bond for aftercare treatment.   RH as to treatment progress set for 9/22/22 at 4:00 PM via Zoom.  Attorney Willett to make arrangements for DE to appear via Zoom along with someone from Fahrman Center.   Adj. 3:00 PM
Review hearing on September 22, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on August 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

9:17 AM Defendant Jacob J Shimko in court.  Attorney Stephen Donald Willett in court for Jacob J Shimko.  Attorney Emily Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. Heard along with 21TR458, 21TR459, 21TR460, 21TR461, 22CF48, 21CM145. 

22CF48 PH.  State calls Deputy Bryce Baier, oath administered. Direct by the State. Record shall reflect witness has identified the Defendant. Objection/overruled. State has filed a certified bond from Chippewa County, Court will take judicial notice of document. 9:33am Cross by Atty Willett. Objection/Sustained. Objection/sustained. Objection/Sustained. Objection/sustained.  9:46am Witness dismissed.  Court finds PC, will bind over for Trial. 

22CF125-Init App. Waive reading of the CC.  DE/Atty will waive TL for PH, court instructs.  
21CM145-Track with other cases.   Set for Arraignment/PH/RH Set for October 24,  2022 @ 1:30pm.  

DE will be entering into the Fharman Center for treatment, when DE is accepted bond will be reviewed at that time.  Adj 9:57 am.
Initial appearance on August 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Letter dated 8/03/22 from SDW requesting personal appearance for DE and Init App be scheduled in 22CF125 at this same time.
